summary:
• The Taliban is trying to reconcile science and religion in addressing climate change.
• They aim to find ways to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and slow down global warming within an Islamic framework.
• This effort involves exploring traditional practices that can help mitigate the effects of climate change while staying true to their religious beliefs.

• Abuse revelations spark debate on teaching Alice Munro's work in Canadian classrooms
• Professors struggle to balance literary merit with sensitivity towards students who may have experienced similar trauma
• Some educators consider omitting certain stories or using alternative materials to avoid triggering harmful emotions

• Núñez had an altercation with Colombian fans during a match.
• The incident led to tension between him and some spectators.
• He faced criticism from both the fans and media.

• Five people have been imprisoned in relation to the murder of an Ecuadorian presidential candidate.
• The incident has sparked widespread outrage among Ecuadorians and human rights groups.
• The case is being closely monitored by international organizations due to its political implications.

• 4,000-year-old axe-heads have been discovered.
• The axe-heads were sent to a museum.
• The source of the axe-heads remains unknown.

• Three French rugby players have been charged with rape.
• The incident allegedly occurred during their tour of Argentina.
• They will face trial to determine their guilt or innocence.

• Germany forces some asylum seekers to work.
• Asylum seekers prefer real jobs over forced labor.
• Forced work affects asylum seekers' job prospects in Germany.

• Orban claims to be a peacemaker without a plan.
• He lacks a clear strategy for resolving conflicts globally.
• His actions may be driven by personal interests rather than a genuine desire for peace.

• The Ambani family celebrated with former Prime Ministers, film stars, and athletes.
• Asia's richest person hosted a lavish wedding featuring Bollywood stars and other celebrities.
• Two brothers from a wealthy business family got married in a highly publicized event.

• Israeli strikes kill 90 people in Gaza, including Hamas military chief.
• Israeli military claims to have failed to protect Gaza border town.
• Israel and Hamas close to ceasefire deal.

• Kenyan President has fired his unpopular cabinet members after weeks of public unrest.
• The move comes as part of efforts to address widespread discontent among citizens.
• This development is expected to bring about positive change in the country's governance structure.

• At least 10 children were killed when a building collapsed at a school in Lagos.
• The incident occurred during a morning assembly at the school.
• Rescue efforts are ongoing to locate any survivors trapped under the rubble.

• U.S.-China rivalry extends to music industry with competition over who can produce better K-pop songs.
• In South Korea, popular Trader Joe's seasoning is banned due to its high salt content being seen as unhealthy by the Korean government.
• The ban on Trader Joe's seasoning has led to widespread outrage among consumers in South Korea.

• Three countries vie for talented player Lamine Yamal.
• Spaniards believe they have strong chance to win Euro 24 title.

• Zelensky visits Ireland
• Taoiseach vows to visit Kyiv
• Ukraine-Ireland relations strengthened through these trips

• Princess Kate to present trophy to men's Wimbledon winner
• Palace announces royal presence at tennis tournament
• Traditional Wimbledon ceremony to take place on Centre Court

• Shots were fired at a Donald Trump rally; Trump was rushed offstage and the attacker died.
• Dr. Ruth Westheimer, a celebrity sex therapist, passed away at 96 years old.
• Alec Baldwin's Rust trial has been dismissed due to hidden evidence.

• A massacre survivor refuses to forgive Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe's soldiers.
• The survivor seeks justice for the atrocities committed by the soldiers.
• The incident highlights ongoing human rights abuses in Zimbabwe under Mugabe's regime.
